channel.title: Comments on: Retrieving user profile data from Login With Amazon on Alexa

item.title: By: Andrey
item.dc:creator: Andrey
item.description:
Great post. Usually, when setting up Account Linking we follow these 4 simple steps:
1. Set up Security Profile for Login with Amazon 2. Enable Account Linking in Amazon Developer Console 3. Add Redirect URLs to Security Profile 4. Make an API call to Amazon Profile API with BotTalk (no node.js needed)
We put out a nice tutorial summing it all up with lots of pictures =) https://docs.bottalk.de/tutorials/alexa-login-with-amazon-email

item.title: By: Will Cooke
item.dc:creator: Will Cooke
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2017/03/27/retrieving-user-profile-data-from-login-with-amazon-on-alexa/#comment-172">Virginia</a>.
Hi Virginia,
In order to include external Python packages in your Lambda code you need to create a Python Deployment Package with requests included and then upload that with your code to Lambda. If that's something lots of people are struggling with I could write up how to do it, but I learned if from here:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/lambda-python-how-to-create-deployment-package.html
Hope that helps.
item.content:encoded:

Hope that helps.
